Replies.Reply: Vita aenigma est. Life is a puzzle. It is. Specifically, life is most like a crossword puzzle.
Crap.
Four letter word for... vomit.
Not "barf". For sure not "barf".
Four letter word for vomit? S-P-E-
Jesus help me.
You weren't supposed to tell them.
I made a crossword puzzle to help them guess what my job is. You ruined it.

People do crossword puzzles all the time but they don't often think of the person who made all the words fit together, and who thought up the clues, and who made sure the little black squares at the top mirror the ones at the bottom.
Crossword constructors usually have above average intelligence, with knowledge of just about every subject you can imagine. And it helps if they can spell.
Imagine, for a moment, a world without crossword puzzles. A world-
My parents -
Water.
Yep, I live at home...
But so do all of you, so there...
And after people read about those horrors, somebody else has to bring them back from the brink of suicide. Who do you think that is?
Me! My crossword puzzle is always good news. it enlightens.
My job matters, you know. In media circles I am, as the Dutch say, geliefd. That means I have plenty of friends. Hoards, in fact.
That's a pretty blouse.
Twelve letter phrase for smashing success!
As one would say in old Paris...
It means "master stroke", even though the direct translation is actually "master blow"... Leave it to the French to pass off an unpleasant slave activity as an everyday expression.
I sometimes suffer from benign positional vertigo. Could you please not drive until I'm -
Excuse me... pardonnez-moi...
Hello hematoma.

In crosswords, as in life, some days are harder than others. It's true. In the New York Times, for example, the puzzles get harder as the week goes. So on Monday, a day that traditionally bites the big one, the crossword is super easy.
KONCHA, TAKIHASHI-SAN!
Hi Betty.
Did you see the review of "Hairspray" in the Journal yesterday? They used the word "spectacular" -- always a good sign. Maybe you'd like to go see it with rne? I have a coupon for five dollars off.
We could bring your dad if you want. I don't think the show is ageist. That means he won't feel like a loser for being old.
So no then? That's a no?
Sometimes crosswords are even better than life. Here's how.
Crap.
"Brilliant" is what they said.
"Inspired", the teacher told me.
"Engrossing" one child exclaimed.
I'm sure that's what he meant. And "ebullient"-
Dad, some of the greatest orators of all time had their heads chopped off for their labors. I'm lucky to escape with a simple flesh wound.
I told you I'm not going.
Mrs. Alchessi has gliomatosis cerebri.
A brain tumor characterized by, among other things, dementia.
I'm normal.
In fact, I'm normalis extremes.
I'll go.

Carol, tonight I have a date. A blind one. Not the guy, I mean the situation. We are, as yet, unknown to one another... It's nerve wracking, I know. Try not to have a spontaneous epileptiform seizure.
I'd rather not.
i already did. Repeatedly.
Please don't mean on the inside.
Let's hope all that does it for him.
Gods. You may have noticed that I'm wearing clean socks.
And by support I don't mean, you know -
I mean your assistance, your furtherance, your advocacy of my efforts to get out there and... do what I'm supposed to do.
I never went to kindergarten!
They skipped me to the forth grade.
I missed finger painting.
Me too.
You're not her type. And she's married.
Steve?
Is it Steven with a V or Stephen with a P-H?

I thought so. There are almost a million Stevens with a V in the country, you know. It's much more popular than the P-H way, almost twice as popular in fact. I think it's the Brits who prefer the P-H.
Nylon. And mine...
Polyester! See? Both synthetic fibres! And the chances of that are much smaller than the chances of us just wearing blue.
Do you like crosswords?
Me too! And semantics, the study of the meaning of words? You love words, right?
I know!
Steve with a V, you know what we are? We're didymous. Two of a kind. Two rare earth elements brought together by Norns, that's Scandinavian for The Destinies.
I didn't hear it ring.
It's okay. When you get back we can have plenty of quality time.
Steve, this has been a night to remember.
Normal.
Mom, sometimes that's all you need to know he's the one!
Eleven letter word for serendipity.
The perfect answer: S-E-R-E-N-D-I-P-
would find comfort in the words of the learned crossword sages. Above all, my hero is Manny Nosowsky, frequent New York Times contributor and all around cruciverbial master.
Manny says that a crossword puzzle's greatness can be determined by asking three simple questions.
Is it solvable?
Is it entertaining?
Does it s arkle?
Romantic?
Creativo? That's Italian for "creative".
How about -
Oh.
Maybe I could make it up to you by doing a fishing themed crossword.
Okay. I'll just give you some time then. We'll talk next week.
Indeed.
Finished with the Times?
How do you think?
Because if you're thinking that they loved it, that they thought it was imaginative and bold and evocative... you would be right.
He works a lot, you know. Travels all the time. 'Tis possible he has not yet espied it.

But when he does, I'm sure he'll say, "that Mary Horowitz... is a catch. Where oh where has she been all my empty life? From here onward my life will be divided into 'before I met Mary' and 'after I met Mary' with the second part being far superior. I am lonely no more. The missing letter in my puzzle has at last been found."
I'm not.
Four letter word for am I going to wait my whole life for Steve to call?
Nope.
Ow ow ouch.

The news is Steve's life! It's not just what he does, it's who he is, imbedded deep down in his polymer of nucleotides. I should be out there by his side. That's what girlfriends do, isn't it? Let him concentrate on his work. I'll concentrate on the relationship.
Top of the evening.
Exactly! And all I have to do is go to him, be near him, and do my best to radiate... me.
Wherever news happens, Dad.
Abe, Catherine, I'm off. I don't know where I'm going -
Geographically yes, I know.
Mom, two handles, two handles, they both hold stuff, what's the difference?
Disrespect. Do you mean unmannerly, tactless, vulgar?
I don't know when I'll be back but I do know this-
I'm not coming back alone.
Omaha... Einstein... cholera...
Sorry.
Bessemer, Alabama! Named after Sir Henry Bessemer, a Brit. Guess what he did? Perfected the way steel is made, of course.
I won't bore you with the whole story, just the best parts, like how it involves molten pig iron which does not, as one might think, have anything to do with pigs.
You know what else is in Bessemer?
Can you watch my stuff?
Homing pigeons.
Carrier pigeons, despite their name, are more or less useless when it comes to actually carrying anything. Homing pigeons are better for messenger work...
You know who used them all the time? Genghis Khan. Loved the pigeons, scared to death of pooches though.
You know, dogs, canines, de honden?
My boyfriend is probably holding that camera right now.
Crap! Crap, crap, crap!
Do you know when the next bus to Dallas goes through here?
I missed mine.
You ever killed animals?
Set a garbage can full of kittens on fire or anything like that?
Humans?
Touche, sir. Touche.
Do you have a .light? Matches, Zippo, blow torch, et al?
May I see your license?
Norman James Durwood.
Mary Magdalene Horowitz.
Norm, if you're going to rape and murder me, you'll have to cut me up into a million chunks and scatter me all over four states, otherwise this appendage -
Will lead homicide detectives right to you.
And you already told me you don't have a light to burn the flesh off.
Moon Pies! Want to go halfsies?
And my other rule about crossword puzzles is this. No pencils.
If you're going to do a crossword, you should do it fearlessly, with abandon, and with a pen. I prefer a medium tip, felt, blue -
Oh.
Do you mean quiet as in softly hushed like this? Or do you mean quiet, as in silent?
Norm?
Thanks for not raping me.
Eight letter word for "screwed".
F-A-S-T-E-N-E-D. Fastened.
That's what's great about crosswords, and life. Every once in a while, you get a surprise.
All roads lead to Oklahoma, Papa.

My road, dad. My road. You don't commit to a relationship and then give up because you'd rather be at home curled up in front of the fireplace with a thesaurus. This is what people are supposed to do -
Just think of this like the time I went to Girl Scout camp, except for the part where I got kicked out.
Steve!
I'm here! Surprised?
Astounded, flabbergasted, bushwacked -
Talking to you. And noticing how the Oklahoma climate agrees with your complexion.
Of course not... I went to Dallas looking for you first. And you know why?
Because you're inimitable and I'm intransigent.
It means you're awesome and I'm unstoppable.
Mind blowing.
I know. I'm just here to support you, show you I care, and also ask why you aren't following that guy pretending to be a nurse but obviously not wearing sterilizable, non-slip footwear.
If I was Baby Peggy's dad, that's how I'd avoid the press too.
I'll be right here in case you want to make out later on!
Thanks. I found them in an alley.
Neither really.
I'm just here because my boyfriend is working the story. He's with CNN, the world's news leader, the most trusted name in news, the place where more -
I'm definitely pro-leg.
Thanks, Bruno.
Crap.
Mary.
Thank y-
No?
Of course. I don't want to interfere in his work but I just need to be here for him and -
Pro-leg.
She'd just be like the tree frogs.
in tree frogs. It happens all the time. In some ponds there's like a quarter of the tree frogs with extra legs. Totally natural.
There you go, George. Just a little nasolacrimal duct cleaning.
Steve!
Steve! STEVE!
Steve? Are you okay? Is he okay?
Oh no.
Thank you.
What if it's a viral zoonotic disease? He should see a doctor.
But wait, what if -
Will you take care of him?

Elizabeth! I have to meet Steve at his next job, in New Mexico. He's sick, not as in rad, although he is that too, but more like unwell, infirm, perhaps barfy. Hopefully nothing serious but you never can be too sure and besides, healthy or not, he needs me.

The trip's not too long, right through all kinds of interesting sites like, for example, El Santuario de Chimayo: The Lourdes of America. Know what that is? A sacred sand pit near a burrito stand. What could be better than that?
Want to go? Unless you're busy, I mean. You probably have something better to do.
What kind of car do you have?
What year?
Replace the recalled seat belts?
Let's grab souvenirs!

Here's something you never see in crosswords, two letter words, and thank goodness for that. The word "go": not fun. The word "vamoose": super fun. You see? crosswords are just like life in that way -
Thanks.
Howard, if you get sleepy and want to trade off driving for a while, just wake me up and I'll take over.
caffeine. Just sugar and my natural tendency to, you know, never fall asleep.
Persimmon. AKA, the mabolo, the date-plum, the velvet apple.
Be has a point.
I have to go find Steve. How do I look?
I'll be back. Save me a sign! And if Cloris comes out, tell her I loved her in "My Little Pony: The Movie".
Slept on it in the car. Where's Steve? Is he okay?
Hello... Bonjour... Hola...
Poker? Technically I'm familiar but I've never actually played.
"There are few things that are so unpardonably neglected in our country as poker." Guess who said that one.
Mark Twain. And you know what else-
Sorry.
Send it, ladies!
Thank God you're okay!
I'm not. It's more like picking travel destinations based on where you happen to be working.
Hartman told me you wanted me here.
Hartman said you'd say that.
And he said you'd say that too.
guy with an attractive girl and you think how the heck did he pull that off? People won't think that when they look at us. We're perfectly matched.
Stop it, you guys! Stop! "Victory attained by violence is tantamount to a defeat, for it is momentary."
No! This isn't about money! It's about courage, love, honor and all things virtuous and pure. Steve, kick him in the leberknoedel!
He fought for me.
OH MY GOD, STEVE, YOU'RE BLEEDING!
Please! Somebody help him! Apply a vasoconstrictor, a nasal tampon, anything! At the absolute least, direct pressure and a clean tissue!
What? I didn't -
Wait! Steve!
No, wait! Attendee!
STEVE! STEVE!
But I do! If you're in trouble because of me I can fix it, I can explain to your boss. He or she probably just doesn't understand our relationship.
Sure we do, it's just in the pupa stage right now.
Six letter word for "over my lifeless, rigormortic and maggot infested, i.e. dead, body am I giving up now"... D-O-G-G-
Normally I don't condone swearing.
I got him in trouble, Dad. I have to go find him and make it right.

For each story, I've worked out an equation of potential human casualties, estimated property damage, availability of endlessly repeatable images, with bonus points for anything involving reporters in galoshes. There's no doubt in my mind. They're heading to the storm in Galveston.
I can't think of work at a time like this!
Ridiculous? Mom! How many times did you propose to dad?
I rest my case! If you gave up the first time dad said no then I wouldn't exist. Telling me to give up so soon on my potential husband-
Sure you don't want to come along?
How bad could it be?

And when I met Steve, I knew right away we had a lot in common. We're both in the media, we both love crosswords, we both love words. We both felt this unexplainable connection, no matter how much his instinct might be to fight it.
Crap.
If there's one thing I learned from crossword puzzles it's that you can't give up.
Sometimes you run into a doozy and you think you'll never be able to solve it in a million years. If you quit, you're right, but if you stick with it, you'll figure it out. Eventually.
I have to give it one more try. I have to fix the mess I made with his work, then maybe he and I --
Me too.
Oh my God.
Crap!
I spy with my little eye a chemical element from group two of the periodic table.
Cobalt.
Mother Teresa.
But you're out now.
Maybe there is.
They're fuscous, that means -
You know what I'd call this?
Imbroglio, Howard. That means we're screwed.
"Eunice, Louisiana. Please..."
See? He needs me, if only to help with his spelling.
Please let those kids be okay.
George, Lydia! What's going on?
Eight letter word for... my life has come to this.
Not destiny, that's only seven letters. Not fortuity - that sounds more like when good things happen to people like finding a quarter in the sofa or something.
F-O-R-E-D-0-0-M. Foredoom.
Crap.
I am not afraid. I am not fearful, pusillanimous, nor am I affrighted.
Oh my God, they forgot one! You scared the crap out of me.
I'm sorry, can you hear me, I mean at all? Do you have sensorineural hearing loss or conductive? "Deaf people can do anything except hear." You know who said that?
And then there's black lung disease, also a problem in coal mines. Chronic cough, breathlessness, cyanosis - that's where your skin turns purple --
Rhinolith, that's the real word.
And Archimedes, there's another one. He was into math, philosophy, all kinds of stuff, then one day he was working out an equation in the sand and somebody stabbed him.
Happenstance, I love that word too.

No dessert. Crappy. Did you know that the word dessert comes from an old French word that means "clear the table"? Sometimes I feel like dinner is just doing time so I can get to the point, and of course the point always involves sugar. Who needs -
I know.
I know.
I'm not good at... silence. "Mary doesn't do quiet", that's how my grandmother always said it.
I just wanted to be normal, that's all. Steve said I was.
I'm beginning to think newsmen can't entirely be trusted.
The truth is normal is -- not me.
My friends, the people I've met over the past week, they're not normal either. They're more interesting, more original, more real, more rare.
That's where I fit.
Little Deaf Girl, it's time for us to go home.
After I got kicked out of Girl Scouts, while the other girls were learning how to sell cookies, I was at home reading the biography of Sir Edmund Hillary.
If life is like a crossword puzzle then its worth, its greatness, its raison d'efre should be judged in the same way.
Is it solvable?
Is it entertaining?
Does it sparkle?
And does it fit?
I am.
My brain is full of all kinds of information, some of it useful, some of it not.
In solving the puzzle of life there's one thing you must do.
Find somebody just as normal as you.
if not a whole bunch.
And don't be a slave to your loins.
You need to let this be the boss of you. Cornprende ?
He's my favorite behavioral geneticist in the world.
Good one.
My grandma left it to me. My parents won't stay here. And for me it was always too... quiet.
Not anymore.
We're ready for you now.

Here's a treat, students. Our final guest for Career Day, Miss Mary Horowitz, is the crossword constructor for the Atlanta Citizen. You know the crossword puzzles you see every week in the newspaper? It's her job to create them. Isn't that fun?
Pardon me?
Oh, I'm so sorry.
Maybe you could tell them a bit about what your job is like?
Daniel, you have a question?
Children!
Are you okay?
Water. Just hang on.
Who's ready for some fun?
Mary drops thu p file out her the bottom She p lls u hearsed enthusiasm.
You make a living doing that? Just making puzzles? The Atlanta Citizen only comes out on Fridays.
You live with your parents?
How do you pay your rent?
Oh my God, how old are you? Still living at home!
You're a freak.
Did you start this and not bother finishing it? Do you know how much work goes into making these things?
Nine dollar twenty.
Pecha kucha! Do Itta!
Where the hell is he?
Pandemic.
Half of the Midwest and spreading.
Always a possibility.
Hartman, come on.
We're going to hit rush. We'll have to take the second flight.
Take a look at those... plants.
Rebecca wants you to come for dinner when we're back home. Her cousin from Florida -
What?
She's hot.
You let you mother set you up?
Wherever news goes...
Here?
Is she hot?
I've been married to the same woman for seventeen years. I care.
For now.
Is that her? She's hot.
She's really hot.
I don't think we've met. Angus.
Your eyes are striking.
Nothing wrong with that one.
My dear, sit.
Verdict's in.
Consider yourself temporarily saved by the storm. It's worse than they thought. We've got to move.
He'll probably fire you after.
She's too smart to come here during this.
We can't just leave them.
Christ, you two. You'll get us killed.
Corbitt wants you to go on air to talk about Mary. An interview with the boyfriend.
Close enough. Come on, we need this.
Fox has already got their hands on everything but her panty size.
Corbitt wants you on in five.
Probably doing his nails.
Bird flu is for pussies. This thing's unstoppable.
Squirrels.
Exactly.
Who wishes he was in Iraq now?
Next E-coli story breaks, he'll be fine.
Mary, hi. I'm Steve.
Great. Thanks.
Ready?
Mrs. Horowitz. Goodnight.
Sir.
Sorry about this blind date thing.
Okay.
Sorry?
Whoa!
Mary... uh, what about your mother?
No, we're right in front of your house and...
And I have no problem with that whatsoever.
Mary.
V.
Sure.
What's not to love.
Sorry. I have to get this.
Vibrate.
You didn't?
This is Steve... What? Really?
Work. I have to go to... Boston.
Sure. I'll call you.
No kidding. You certainly are -
You read my mind.
What?... Mom, let me call you back.
What page?
Jesus.
But then we wouldn't have heard about horse heaven.
Forget it.
It's a set up.
I don't care. Never again. My mom set me up with this chick -
Yeah, go ahead and suggest that.
Mind if I ask you a few questions on camera?
How do you feel about what's going on here?
Please God, no.
Surprised?
What are you doing?
Tell me you didn't come all the way here just to see me.
No, we're not. I don't know what that means but trust me. We're so not.
Great. Listen, Mary, you seem like a nice girl, and the ten minutes we spent together were --
Sure, but I'm working here.
She's on me what, thirty seconds after meeting me, and the chick will not shut up the whole time. I had to fake a work call, gave her the -
I think I'm in the clear, then she does this crossword - she works for the Citizen - she does this crossword all about me, and as if that's not crazy enough, she shows up here.
Over by the fence. Red boots.
Jesus, Angus. When a psychotic chick's swinging a machete at your throat, who cares if she's hot?
Crazy, man. The chick is cra-zy.
Hughes, don't. Don't even.
Tell me you weren't talking to Mary.
Go to hell, Hughes.
Tree frog? Where do you get this shit?
No, go. Fast.
Don't.
Hughes, I swear I'll kill you.
Angus, come on man, get me out of here.
Who cares? Jesus, you guys -
You're an asshole, Hughes.
You have to stop stalking me.
Stalking.
This is crazy.
Go home, Mary.
He's not my friend, he's not your friend. He's just an asshole who thinks it's fun to string you along and make my life hell.
Hughes! Get out here!
HUGHES!
Tell her the truth. About all the crap you told her.
Tell her!
How long do you figure until -
This girl. She's been following me... She's not my girlfriend...
I'm done?
Any luck, the storm will kill me first.
Considering you probably just cost me my job, maybe you don't want to talk to me right now.
We don't have a relationship.
Mary, go home!
Go home.
You had to get the pier shot. Had to. Just about got us all killed.
You're such an asshole.
GO AWAY, GO AWAY, GO AWAY!
Who the hell are you? What are you doing?
You seen her?
No, she's here somewhere. I can feel it.
They're deaf, asshole.
We're not stopping.
Highway patrol's down here every hour. It's not like they'll rot in the ditch.
What the hell are you doing?
Hughes!
You're not telling her where we're going.
Asshole!
No, no, no.
Mrs. Horowitz.
You and your husband stay put, Mrs.
They'll have her out before you even make it to the airport...
She better be.
I'm not her boyfriend!
Thank Christ. Now if they can only get her out of there.
Mary... she's smart, incredibly smart. She talks a lot. Never boring, I'll tell you that much.
Mary Horowitz doesn't pretend to be anything she's not. She's passionate, beautiful, real... and she definitely doesn't deserve to be where she is now.
What do you mean "the big one"?
Please let it be the bird flu.
How's it spreading?
Oh my God, they're everywhere!
Al Qaeda connection?
Not me!.
I need blush. No, wait. I'll go pasty. It'll look like I could be the first media victim. "Hartman Hughes, no such thing as too close to the story".
Assholes! I knew it was too good to be true.
I had a perfectly good bologna sandwich going on upstairs.
Of course not. Nice camera work, Stevie.
Paula, what started out as a routine rehearsal here at the Dallas Medieval Times turned deadly when an employee allegedly turned on his fellow performers. Twenty-

The castle you see behind me is one of eight medieval Times dinner theatre restaurants. Guests who cross the drawbridge enjoy a medieval style feast while watching the main attraction: knights engaging in a battle of strength and skill. The restaurant promises "fun, feasting and fighting" but it appears that this time, fun was in short supply.
Paula, devastating news just in.
At times like this, I like to think there's a heaven just for horses.
May you long roam in that heaven, noble horse -

But not quite yet. We're the first to report, the horse is not dead, Paula. Not dead. The horse is alive and well after having merely fainted, as it was trained to do for the show. One happy, blessed miracle...
while a deranged madman continues to hold the lives of his coworkers in his depraved hands.
Dammit, Angus. Get it a bit closer to right before you hand it to me.
It's that kind of genius that won me the Southeast Idaho Christian Family Coalition's Journalist of the Year award, you ingrates.

Perhaps the greatest obstacle the hostage negotiators face is the suspect's refusal to communicate using modern day technology. In keeping with his role as a medieval knight, he's insisting on an eleventh century messenger to deliver all communication.
Actually, homing pigeons.
You can buy them on the internet for twenty-five bucks a pop.
Which one of you bastards hid my bronzing shimmer?

"God wouldn't have given my child the third leg if he didn't want her to keep it." But for now, the fate of that precious child's third leg is the hands of a judge... This is Hartman Hughes reporting, live from Oklahoma City.
What if next time I say Baby Peggy is like the wishbone of her parents' dispute?
Priceless! This is priceless!
M'lady.
Hartman Hughes.
Mary'. Mary, Mary, Mary.
Steve told me you were beautiful.
Listen, Mary, I've been working with Steve for about a year now.
Girls follow us around everywhere we go. Who do you think they're after?

Me, of course me, but every once in a while some of them try to land Steve. It's true. Sure he'll go for a few skanks here and there but it's all just a sad attempt to hide his fear. All he wants is to love but he's afraid of opening up, afraid of putting himself out there, afraid of somebody like you, Mary - yes you - afraid of you breaking his heart. Can you blame him?
No! Promise me this. Promise you'll stick around long enough to help him get over that fear. He tells you to go away, don't. He says he thinks you're crazy?
Good girl.
I'll tell Steve to come find you when we wrap for the day. What side are you on?
You might want to jump camps. No way they're going let that baby keep the third leg and live like a freak. Trust me.
What's going on?
No amputation?
Who?
It's over? The kid keeps the leg.
'Til she gets it caught in a car door.
And like the noble tree frog whose extra leg is nothing if not natural, so Baby Peggy begins the rest of her three legged life...
A little thing called astutitude, my friends.
Angus, hold up.
Hi beautiful.
Steve's not feeling well.
I'm sure he'll be fine by the time we get to New Mexico.
Steve really wants you to follow us. It would mean a lot to him.
He was going to go ask you himself but look at the poor bastard. So sick he can't even sit up straight.
Exactly what I told him, but the only person he wants touching his infected flesh is you.
Hey now, we need you to be strong for him. Leachinan trial, Santa Fe, can you remember that?
We'll meet you there, God willing.
Like he's my own.
But the octogenarian Leachman may not have been as innocent as her representatives claimed, at least according to the evidence found at the murder scene.
Whips, hot wax, bamboo skewers, a spanking bench, and perhaps most damaging, a henna tattoo across Ms.
Hi gorgeous. What'd you do to your hair?
Never better. Come in and wait.
You all know Mary? Steve's girlfriend?
Don't go, Steve! Look who's here.
For the hundredth time, Steve, no, I am not interested in a threesome with you and your new girlfriend.
Okay. Fine.
Everything I said about Steve, about his feelings for you, his hopes, his dreams, his fears, his unexplainable odor, forget about it. Forget everything I said.
Because nothing I said comes close to the enormity of Steve's real feelings for you!
It's a love that defies words!
Okay, alright.
Mary, millions of people believe what I tell them every night. Why shouldn't you?
And as she left the court room today a free woman, the cheers of her devoted fans carrying her forward -

As you can see, Cloris Leachman's fans have become surprisingly violent despite her victory here today. Add this to the list of the most dangerous locations for journalists. Iraq, Somalia, Lebanon, Sri Lanka... and just about any place Cloris Leachman fans gather.
Hartman Hughes putting his life at risk to report live from Santa Fe, New Mexico.
This is my gift, understand, my instrument. Makes no difference if you're walking around looking like Quasimodo.
Sorry, darling, we're on to the next story.
And this time, the warnings were hard to ignore. One Galvestonian told us "tornados, we can handle.

With mere hours to spare, the Dunlevys reconciled, agreeing to halt surgery until Baby Peggy is old enough to decide for herself.
